definitions.definition: ( in many religions , uncountable ) A place of torment where some or all sinners are believed to go after death and evil spirits are believed to be.

main_definition: ( in many religions , uncountable ) A place of torment where some or all sinners are believed to go after death and evil spirits are believed to be.

definitions.definition: A place or situation of great suffering in life.
examples: My new boss is making my job a hell .
I went through hell to get home today.
callback hell ; < table > hell ; < div > hell
You don’t have a snowball's chance in hell .

definitions.definition: Used as an intensifier in phrases grammatically requiring a noun.
examples: I’m as mad as hell and I’m not going to take it anymore.
What the hell is wrong with you?!
He says he’s going home early? Like hell he is.

definitions.definition: A place into which a tailor throws shreds , or a printer discards broken type .
In certain games of chase , a place to which those who are caught are carried for detention .

examples: That steep staircase is hell on my knees.

main_definition: ( countable , hyperbolic , figuratively ) A place or situation of great suffering in life.
secondary_definitions: ( sometimes vulgar ) Used as an intensifier in phrases grammatically requiring a noun.
( obsolete ) A place into which a tailor throws shreds , or a printer discards broken type .
In certain games of chase , a place to which those who are caught are carried for detention .
( colloquial , usually with on ) Something extremely painful or harmful (to)
